title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 24/89 of 5 January 1989 suspending the preferential customs duties and re- introducing the common customs tariff duty on imports of large-flowered roses originating in Israel
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 24/89
of 5 January 1989
suspending the preferential customs duties and re-introducing the Common Customs Tariff duty on imports of large - flowered roses originating in Israel
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: For imports of large-flowered roses originating in Israel, the preferential customs duty fixed by Council Regulation (EEC) No 4078/88 is hereby suspended and the Common Customs Tariff duty is hereby reintroduced from 7 January 1989.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 7 January 1989.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
